derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin, band, door frame', related to fasces. Compare with fess

entry.def: In a car, the fascia is the part surrounding the instruments and dials.
The fascia on a shop front is the flat surface above the shop window, on which the name of the shop is written.
The fascia of a mobile phone is its detachable cover.

means.word_mean: 1. a sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue separating or binding together muscles and organs etc
